page.title: 01KENNYTHORPE SAND QUARRY.
page.content: The Jurassic sand in this quarry is over 140m.years old and was formed from{GRANITE}mountains which were then at the Equator.The sand represents the different seasonal levels in the bed of an ancient river estuary.It is 97% pure{SILICA}mixed with{CLAY.}There are very few fossils because the decaying Granite formed a mild acid which made the bones dissolve. Sand is extracted by bulldozer and fed,by conveyor,into a drum where it is washed.600gallons are used for each ton of sand.40tons are quarried in an hour.The water,pumped from a lagoon,washes the clay out.It returns to a settling tank so that it can be re-used.The clean,wet sand dries and can be sold as it is,or,more commonly, be treated to produce{RESIN-COATED {SAND}.
